text: Keg at the brewery. Clear amber, large creamy white head, good retention. Aroma of toasted malt, caramel. Taste is cherry, toasted malt, caramel, hoppy finish. Medium bodied.

On tap at the brewery. Clear amber appearance with a dissipating white head. Aroma of caramel malt, light noble hops, light toffee and light yeast. Similar flavor, adding mild to moderate sweetness and light bitterness. Medium body with a smooth creamy feel, soft carbonation and a light grainy finish. OK.

Bottle, kindly shared by jcwattsrugger, many thanks John. Hazy orange golden color with medium white head. Wheat, banana, clove, malt, caramel in aroma. Wheat, banana in taste together with caramel, herbal hops, spices. Good beer.US state #40.

32 oz growler poured a clear reddish amber with a small lasting crfeamy amber head. Aromas ofn caramel, fruitiness and light earthiness. Palate was light bodied and smooth. Flavors of caramel, fruitiness and a hint of earthiness with a smooth lingering fruity finish.
Growler on the bus at RBSG. Thanks John. From notes. Bread, biscuit and honey. Pretty good.

Sampled at the RBSG 2014. It poured a hazy orange color with a tan head. The aroma was of citrus, herbal hops and a sweet malty aroma. The taste was of gum, herbs, floral and an orange aftertaste. Nice.
Growler. Pours a hazy orange color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty grainy caramel aroma. Fruity sweetish malty grainy caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy caramel finish.
Growler during RBSG 2014 Bus Tour. Hazy golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of skunk, sweet malt, caramel. Tastes of sweet malt, sweet fruit. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

Growler @ Bus. Thanks, John. Light amber colored pour with a white head. Intense caramel, honey, and bread aromas. Slight floral hops and a fair amount of apple. Some orange marmalade as well. Really sweet, fruity taste. Big on peach, orange, and apple. Fair amount of honey and caramel, too. Some toasted bread. Minimal hops and very little bitterness.
Growler on bus. Pours orange gold white head. Nose/taste of honey malt, biscuit and light sweet toasty bread. Medium body.
Half growler. Not super hoppy for a helles maibock, not a terrible lager though.

Growler thanks to John! Pours a clear gold with a near white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has some bread and sweet grains with a bit of straw. Flavor has more bread and sweet grains with a touch of straw.
Thanks to cheers John. Nose is honey and light bread. Taste us sweet and honey with a light alcohol warming.

Sampled on the bus during RBSG. Hazy and foppery. A beige head. Nice fruit and malts combine to make an easy to drink beer. Floral fruity hops. Citrus and tropical. Something like sage. Gentle stuff. Nicely done.

One quart growler purchased from Whole Foods in West Des Moines - pours a burnt orange - creamy, fairly thick head - fairly sweet nose of caramelized sugars, honey, floral hops, some munich malt richness  -creamy texture, low carbonation - rich, smooth maltiness up front - sweetness is a bit much, but a balancing bitterness ardives late - there is a surprising amount of alcohol heat, which makes me wonder if its higher tham 6%- finish of lightly spicy hops - there is a touch of huskiness, but mostly a fairly enjoyable maibock, albeit a bit sweet at times.

Pours a bit more orange than golden, its got a smallish head that leaves some lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is spicy with some honey and herbal hops. Its a clean and inviting aroma. 

The flavor is lightly sweet & features a bunch of spicy happiness, some grassy and honey notes are there as well. Overall its really not a terribly sweet beer and the bitterness balances what sweetness is there very well. 

A nice atypical take on the style.

Maroon reddish orange. 1 finger white head. Nose is peppery rye nose and corn with honey. Very rindy with orange citrus and cloves. Chewy yeasty wheat and spice. Finish is bitter with this cheesy finish

32 oz growler shared by jcwattsrugger. Hazy amber in color with lasting head retention. Nose is caramel covered biscuits with a light yeast note. Mild fruit undertone. 
Flavor is toasted malt, light fruity hints with a bready chewy texture. The body is light with a clean finish. Refreshing and thirst quenching brew. Very sessionable and I could drink a lot of this. Nice stuff John.

From the mini growler shared by jcwattsrugger. Nice medium amber pour. Aroma of sweet malts for certain with little to no hop character. Toasted too. A touch of banana or other meaty fruit. Medium body. Malt character just as strong in the flavor with a mild finish. Likable.

Growlerette shared by jcwattsrugger 
Deep golden color rich bready maltiness clean lager, this is a really nice beer, thanks John!
Aroma is malts/pale malts, citrus and earth. The flavor is citrus, fruit/berries, malts and a slightly dry/tart finish.

Tap @ Confluence. This should be classified as a Heller Bock. Pours a bit hazy, dark orange appearance with a cream colored head. Soft sweet citrusy, herbal hoppy, orange, a bit sweet malty aroma. Light bubblegum, chewy herbal, lightly floral, orange citrusy flavor. Not bad.
Had this on draft at Confluence Brewery in Des Moines. Reddish pour. Bitter and malty flavor. Leaves your mouth dry. Average. Fruity flavor
